suggestedNewContent.title: UserAccountsDrawerHeader
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Demonstrate UserAccountsDrawerHeader widget with currentAccountPicture, accountName, accountEmail, otherAccountsPictures, and onDetailsPressed callback. Show how to build an account switcher.

suggestedNewContent.title: Reusable Drawer Widget Pattern
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show how to create a shared AppDrawer widget that can be imported and used across multiple screens, avoiding code duplication.

suggestedNewContent.title: Responsive Navigation: Drawer vs NavigationRail
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain when to use Drawer (mobile) vs NavigationRail (tablet/desktop) and show LayoutBuilder pattern to switch between them based on screen width.

suggestedNewContent.title: NavigationDrawer with Badges
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Demonstrate adding badge counts to NavigationDrawerDestination items for showing unread counts or notifications.

suggestedNewContent.title: Drawer vs Bottom Navigation Decision Guide
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Clear decision tree: Use BottomNavigationBar for 3-5 primary destinations that need constant visibility. Use Drawer for 6+ destinations, secondary features, or when bottom nav slots are full.

summary: The lesson provides solid coverage of Flutter drawer navigation fundamentals with both Material 2 and Material 3 approaches. Main issues: (1) The WARNING section and several code examples are incomplete, (2) UserAccountsDrawerHeader is mentioned but never demonstrated, (3) Several features mentioned in the summary (badges, GoRouter, custom widths) lack examples, (4) Missing prerequisite context for intermediate learners. The challenge solution is excellent and comprehensive. Priority is MEDIUM because the core concepts are correct but gaps in examples and incomplete sections could confuse learners.
